About

Get to know Eugene a little more.

Eugene Ilin was born in 1996 in Chisinau, Moldova, into a family of musicians. From the young age of 3, he was taught by his father to play scales and simple melodies. Seeing their son's inclinations to music, his parents made it a point to always have a piano at home for the kids to practice on.

Eugene's music environment growing up was influenced by his parents' music endeavors and tastes. His father is a classical saxophone player, who also plays a wide variety of other instruments, including brass, woodwind, guitar, keyboard, and percussion. For a period of time, Eugene's father headed his symphonic orchestra, after which he devoted most of his talents to choral conducting and music department development.

Eugene's mother (who actually taught Eugene his first song on the piano at the age of 6) is a lifelong violin-player and singer. Together, Eugene's parents were part of a recording studio since the end of the 80's.

Having this background, Eugene discovered in himself a talent for effortlessly playing by ear and accompanying other musicians. From age 6, he was accompanying his Sunday school performances in church and grew to become one of the church's leading piano accompanists by age 15.

Eugene studied piano with private teachers from age 7, and joined the church's string ensemble as a pianist at 11, which pushed him to grow beyond his limits and motivated him to continue practicing.

Eugene is a graduate of the IUC ECB Annual Music Institute where he studied voice, conducting, theory, and composition. Since 2014, Eugene has been actively teaching piano, theory, voice, and conducting throughout the country at various music workshops. He enjoys sharing the knowledge he gained with other talented musicians and encourages more musicians to grow in their craft.

Today Eugene resides in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania and leads the church choir and church music department at his church.

Eugene continues to advance himself in music, and aspires to do more of it and better for the good of others and to the glory of God!
